title: How to Make Spiced Nuts

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 300ºF/150ºC.
Beat the egg white until it becomes soft and foamy.
Combine all of the remaining ingredients except for the nuts; whisk into egg white.
Stir in the nuts until well coated.
Spread the mixture in a single layer on an ungreased baking pan.
Bake the nuts for 15 minutes, then remove from oven.
steps.description: Using a metal spatula, toss, stir and separate nuts.

steps.headline: Reduce oven temperature to 250ºF/120ºC and return the nuts to bake until medium brown, about 10 minutes.
Remove from oven; toss and stir again.
Place baking pan on wire rack to cool.
steps.description: Break up any nuts that stick together.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 120ºC/250ºF.
Sift the sugar, salt and spices together.
Beat the water and egg white together.
steps.description: Dip the nuts into the mixture created.

steps.headline: Roll the egg-coated nuts in the sugar and spice mix.
Line a baking sheet with baking/parchment paper.
Arrange the coated nuts across the sheet.
steps.description: Only place in a single layer; do not overlap any nuts.

steps.headline: Place in the preheated oven.
Remove from the oven when done.
steps.description: Place the whole sheet on a wire cooling rack. Leave there to cool completely.

steps.headline: Shake off any excess sugar from the nuts.
steps.description: Serve or store. If storing, place in an airtight container.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 150ºC/300ºF (slow heat).
Add oil to a heavy-based frying pan or skillet.
Cook over low heat.
steps.description: Stir constantly to prevent burning or sticking. Cook for 2 minutes or until it smells fragrant enough.

steps.headline: Remove the spices from the heat.
steps.description: Add the nuts to the pan. Stir through thoroughly to coat with the spices.

steps.headline: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
steps.description: Arrange the nuts in a single layer across the baking sheet.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for 15 minutes or until the nuts appear golden.

steps.headline: Sprinkle with salt to taste.
Serve after the nuts have cooled.
steps.description: If storing, keep in an airtight container.

text: Savory-sweet spiced nuts Preheat oven to 300ºF/150ºC.  Beat the egg white until it becomes soft and foamy.  Combine all of the remaining ingredients except for the nuts; whisk into egg white.  Stir in the nuts until well coated.  Spread the mixture in a single layer on an ungreased baking pan.  Bake the nuts for 15 minutes, then remove from oven. Using a metal spatula, toss, stir and separate nuts. Reduce oven temperature to 250ºF/120ºC and return the nuts to bake until medium brown, about 10 minutes.  Remove from oven; toss and stir again.  Place baking pan on wire rack to cool. Break up any nuts that stick together. Sugar and spice nuts Preheat the oven to 120ºC/250ºF.  Sift the sugar, salt and spices together. Repeat twice. Beat the water and egg white together. Dip the nuts into the mixture created. Roll the egg-coated nuts in the sugar and spice mix.  Line a baking sheet with baking/parchment paper.  Arrange the coated nuts across the sheet. Only place in a single layer; do not overlap any nuts. Place in the preheated oven. Bake for 1.5 to 2 hours. Remove from the oven when done. Place the whole sheet on a wire cooling rack. Leave there to cool completely. Shake off any excess sugar from the nuts. Serve or store. If storing, place in an airtight container. Spiced nuts Preheat the oven to 150ºC/300ºF (slow heat).  Add oil to a heavy-based frying pan or skillet. Add the spices. Cook over low heat. Stir constantly to prevent burning or sticking. Cook for 2 minutes or until it smells fragrant enough. Remove the spices from the heat. Add the nuts to the pan. Stir through thoroughly to coat with the spices. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Arrange the nuts in a single layer across the baking sheet. Place in the oven. Bake for 15 minutes or until the nuts appear golden. Sprinkle with salt to taste. This is optional, however. Serve after the nuts have cooled. If storing, keep in an airtight container.
